quotes.text: I canâ€™t go back to yesterday because I was a different person then.
quotes.author: Lewis Carroll

quotes.text: There are only two kinds of languages: the ones people complain about and the ones nobody uses
quotes.author: Bjarne Stroustrup

quotes.text: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: Inconceivable!
quotes.author: The Princess Bride

quotes.text: Give a man a program, frustrate him for a day. Teach a man to program, frustrate him for a lifetime.
I have made this letter longer than usual because I lack the time to make it shorter
quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

quotes.text: And yet it moves
quotes.author: Galileo Galilei (attributed)

quotes.text: The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, and wiser people so full of doubts.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.text: The woods are lovely dark and deep
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.text: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: it is a tale Told by an idiot, full of sound and fury, Signifying nothing
quotes.author: Shakespeare

quotes.text: from so simple a beginning endless forms most beautiful and most wonderful have been, and are being, evolved.
quotes.author: Charles Darwin

quotes.text: so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us
quotes.author: Gandalf, from The Lord of the Rings

quotes.text: There, peeping among the cloud-wrack above a dark tor high up in the mountains, Sam saw a white star twinkle for a while. The beauty of it smote his heart, as he looked up out of the forsaken land, and hope returned to him. For like a shaft, clear and cold, the thought pierced him that in the end the Shadow was only a small and passing thing: there was light and high beauty for ever beyond its reach.
quotes.author: The Lord of the Rings

quotes.text: Who has never killed an hour? Not casually or without thought, but carefully: a premeditated murder of minutes. The violence comes from a combination of giving up, not caring, and a resignation that getting past it is all you can hope to accomplish.
quotes.author: Mark Z Danielewski, House of Leaves

quotes.text: A man chooses, a slave obeys.
quotes.author: Andrew Ryan, Bioshock

quotes.text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: It is never worth a first-class man's time to express a majority opinion. By definition there are plenty of others to do that.
quotes.author: G H Hardy

quotes.text: I don't therefore I'm not.
You can justify anything by putting it in quotes, adding a famous name and making it a sig
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: So do all who live to see such times, but that is not for them to decide. All you have to decide is what to do with the time that is given to you.
quotes.author: Gandalf, The Lord of the Rings

quotes.text: For Frodo
quotes.author: Aragorn, The Lord of the Rings

quotes.text: A system of cells interlinked within Cells interlinked within cells interlinked Within one stem. And dreadfully distinct Against the dark, a tall white fountain played.
quotes.author: Pale Fire, Vladimir Nabokov
